p: Canine parvovirus (CPV), genus Protoparvovirus, a member of the family Parvoviridae (subfamily Parvovirinae), is a small, highly contagious, nonenveloped, single-stranded DNA virus [ 1]. CPV is a major causative agent of acute gastroenteritis, leukopenia and myocarditis in dogs, and typical clinical signs include vomiting, fever, and diarrhea. Generally, puppies aged 6 weeks to 6 months have been found to be more susceptible to CPV infection [ 2, 3].
